page.title: 01INTRODUCTION SWANAGE
page.content: Swanage is a seaside resort which is famous for its beauty. However for a 1000 years fishing and the stone industry have provided livings for many, but this has become very limited and is now really a novelty. The town's principal industry today is derived from the holiday makers which increases the town's population from 8,500 to 45,000 in the summer. It has been estimated that Swanage and the Isle of Purbeck bring in Â£20million a year. The nature of the resort and its surrounings makes it attractive for family holidays. There are educational visits, including: school studies, activity holidays, diving, walking, sailing, riding, golf and fishing, senior citizens holidays and those for disabled persons. There are also touring holidays linked with many other places in the area.
